values.name: Absolute Value
values.documentation: The absolute value is a measure of how far the number is from zero. If you think of a number line, with zero in the center, all you’re really doing is asking how far away you are from this zero point. For example the Absolute Value of 4 is 4 and the absolute value of -6 is 6.

Value.documentation: You can specify any Value Syntax to define the Absolute Value.

values.name: Add
values.documentation: The sum of two numbers or vectors. This value will add the two specified values.

Value.documentation: You can specify any Value Syntax to define either addend.
You can specify any Value Syntax to define either addend.

values.name: All Dead Players
values.documentation: An array containing all dead players on a team in a match. A player is defined as being dead when they are eliminated but have not yet respawned back into the game.

Team.documentation: You can specify any Team Syntax to define the array.

values.name: All Heroes
values.documentation: An array of all heroes in Overwatch. Not to be confused with the All Players array

values.name: All Living Players
values.documentation: An array containing all living players on a team in a match. A player is defined as being alive when they are spawned into the game but have not yet been eliminated since spawning.

Team.documentation: You can specify any Team Syntax to define the array.

values.name: All Players
values.documentation: An array containing all players on a team in a match.

Team.documentation: You can specify any Team Syntax to define the array.

values.name: All Players Not On Objective
values.documentation: An array containing all players occupying neither a payload nor a control point (either on a team or in a match).

Team.documentation: You can specify any Team Syntax to define the array.

values.name: All Players On Objective
values.documentation: An array containing all players occupying either a payload or a control point (either on a team or in a match).

Team.documentation: You can specify any Team Syntax to define the array.

values.name: Allowed Heroes
values.documentation: The array of heroes from which the specified player is currently allowed to select.

Player.documentation: You can specify any Player Syntax to define the array.

values.name: Altitude Of
values.documentation: The player’s current height in meters above a surface. Results in a 0 whenever the place is on a surface.

Player.documentation: You can specify any Player Syntax to define the array.

values.name: And
values.documentation: Whether both of the two inputs are true or equivalent to true.

Value.documentation: You can specify any Value Syntax to define both of the required values.
You can specify any Value Syntax to define both of the required values.

values.name: Angle Difference
values.documentation: The difference between two angles, after the angles are wrapped within +/- 180 of each other, the result is positive if the second angle is greater than the first angle, otherwise the result is zero or negative.

Angle.documentation: You can specify any Angle Syntax to define both of the required values.
You can specify any Angle Syntax to define both of the required values.

values.name: Append To Array
values.documentation: A copy of an array with one or more values appended to the end.

Array.documentation: You must specify the Array Syntax you are adding the value to.

Value.documentation: You must specify the Value Syntax that you are adding to the array.

values.name: Array Contains
values.documentation: Whether the specified array contains the specified value.

Array.documentation: You must specify the Array Syntax you are comparing the value to.

Value.documentation: You must specify the Value Syntax that you are comparing to the array.

values.name: Array Slice
values.documentation: A copy of the specified array containing only values from a specified index range.

Array.documentation: You must specify the Array Syntax you are comparing the value to.

Start Index.documentation: The first index of the range. Can use most Value Syntax to specify with.

Count.documentation: The number of elements in the resulting array. The resulting array will contain fewer elements if the specified range exceeds the bounds of the array. Can use any Number-based Value Syntax to specify with.

values.name: Attacker
values.documentation: The player that dealt damage for the event currently being processed by this rule. May be the same as the victim or the event player.

values.name: Backward
values.documentation: Shorthand for the direction vector(0, 0, -1) which points backwards.

values.name: Closest Player To
values.documentation: The player closest to a position, optionally restricted by team.

Center.documentation: The position to which to measure proximity. Can use most Value Syntax related to reporting a position in the map.

Team.documentation: You can specify any Team Syntax to restrict which players is reported when defining this value.

values.name: Compare
values.documentation: Whether the comparison of the two inputs is true.

Value.documentation: The left hand side of the comparison. This may be any value type if the operation is == or =!, otherwise real numbers are expected. Can use most Value Syntax for the comparison.
The left hand side of the comparison. This may be any value type if the operation is == or =!, otherwise real numbers are expected. Can use most Value Syntax for the comparison.

values.name: Control Mode Scoring Percentage
values.documentation: The score percentage for the specified team in the control mode.

Team.documentation: You can specify any Team Syntax to define which team reported when defining this value.

values.name: Control Mode Scoring Team
values.documentation: The team that is currently accumulating score percentage in control mode Results in all if neither team is accumulating score.

values.name: Count Of
values.documentation: The number of elements in the specified array.

Array.documentation: You must specify the Array Syntax you are counting the elements to.

values.name: Cosine From Degrees
values.documentation: The cosine of a specified angle in degrees. The cosine of the angle is equal to the length of the adjacent side divided by the length of the hypotenuse.

Angle.documentation: You can specify any Angle Syntax to define this value.

values.name: Cosine From Radians
values.documentation: The cosine of a specified angle in radians. The cosine of the angle is equal to the length of the adjacent side divided by the length of the hypotenuse. A radian is a unit of angle, equal to an angle at the center of a circle whose arc is equal in length to the radius.

Angle.documentation: You can specify any Angle Syntax to define this value.

values.name: Cross Product
values.documentation: The cross product of the specified values.

Value.documentation: You must specify the first Value Syntax to compare to the second.
You must specify the first Value Syntax to compare to the second.

values.name: Current Array Element
values.documentation: The current array element being considered. Only meaningful during the evaluation of values such as filtered array and sorted array.

values.name: Direction From Angles
values.documentation: The unit-length direction vector corresponding to the specified angles.

Horizontal Angle.documentation: The horizontal angle in degrees used to construct the resulting vector. Most angle based Value Syntax can be used here.

Vertical Angle.documentation: The vertical angle in degrees used to construct the resulting vector. Most angle based Value Syntax can be used here.

values.name: Direction Towards
values.documentation: The unit-length direction vector from position to another.

Start Pos.documentation: The position from which the resulting direction vector will point. Most positional based Value Syntax can be used here.

End Pos.documentation: The position to which the resulting direction vector will point. Most positional based Value Syntax can be used here.

values.name: Distance Between
values.documentation: The distance between two positions in meters.

Start Pos.documentation: One of the two positions used in the distance measurement. Most positional based Value Syntax can be used here.

End Pos.documentation: One of the two positions used in the distance measurement. Most positional based Value Syntax can be used here.

values.name: Divide
values.documentation: The ratio of two numbers or vectors. A vector divided by a number will yield a scaled vector. Division by zero results in zero.

Value.documentation: The left-hand operand, may be any value that results in a number or a vector. Any Value Syntax may be used here.
The left-hand operand, may be any value that results in a number or a vector. Any Value Syntax may be used here.

values.name: Dot Product
values.documentation: The dot product of the specified values. The dot product tells you what amount of one vector goes in the direction of another.

Value.documentation: One of the two vector operands of the dot product. Any positional based Syntax may be used here.
One of the two vector operands of the dot product. Any positional based Syntax may be used here.

values.name: Down
values.documentation: Shorthand for the direction vector(0, -1, 0) which points down.

values.name: Empty Array
values.documentation: An array with no elements.

values.name: Entity Exists
values.documentation: Whether the specified player, icon entity, or effect entity still exists. Useful for determining if a player has left the match or an entity has been destroyed.

Entity.documentation: The player, icon entity, or effect entity whose existance to check.

values.name: Event Player
values.documentation: The player executing the rule, as specified by the event, may be the same as the attacker or victim.

values.name: Facing Direction Of
values.documentation: The unit-length directional vector of a player’s current facing relative to the world. This value includes both horizontal and vertical facing.

Player.documentation: The player whose facing direction to acquire. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: False
values.documentation: The Boolean value of false.

values.name: Farthest Player From
values.documentation: The player farthest to a position, optionally restricted by team.

Center.documentation: The position to which to measure proximity. Can use most Value Syntax related to reporting a position in the map.

Team.documentation: You can specify any Team Syntax to restrict which players is reported when defining this value.

values.name: Filtered Array
values.documentation: A copy of the specified array with any values that do not match the specified condition removed.

Array.documentation: The array whose copy will be filtered. Can use most Array Syntax to specify.

Condition.documentation: The condition that is evaluated for each element of the copied array. If the condition is true, the element is kept in the copied array. Use the current array element value to reference the element of the array currently being considered.

values.name: First Of
values.documentation: The value at the started of the specified array. Results in a 0 if the specified array is empty.

Array.documentation: The array from which the value is acquired. Can use most Array Syntax to specify.

values.name: Flag Position
values.documentation: The position of a specific team’s flag in Capture the Flag.

Team.documentation: The team whose flag position to acquire.

values.name: Forward
values.documentation: Shorthand for the direction vector(0, 0, 1) which points forward.

values.name: Global Variable
values.documentation: The current value of a global variable, which is a variable which belongs to the custom game itself.

Variable.documentation: Variable specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

values.name: Has Spawned
values.documentation: Whether an entity has spawned in the world. Results in false for players who have not chosen a hero yet.

Entity.documentation: The player, icon entity, or effect entity whose presence in world to check.

values.name: Has Status
values.documentation: Whether the specified player has the specified status, either from the set status action or from a non-scripted game mechanic.

Player.documentation: The player whose status to check.

Status.documentation: The status to check for. Values include Hacked, Burning, Knocked Down, Asleep, Frozen, Unkillable, Invincible, Phased Out, Rooted, or Stunned.

values.name: Health
values.documentation: The current health of a player including armor and shields.

Player.documentation: The player whose health to acquire.

values.name: Hero
values.documentation: A hero constant. Specifies one of the available heroes by name in the game.

Hero.documentation: A hero constant. (i.e. Tracer, Reaper, Mercy, Reinhardt. etc.)

values.name: Hero Icon String
values.documentation: Converts a hero parameter into a string that shows up as an icon.

Value.documentation: The hero that will be converted as an icon.

values.name: Hero Of
values.documentation: The Current Hero of a Player.

Player.documentation: The player whose hero to acquire. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Horizontal Angle From Direction
values.documentation: The horizontal angle in degrees corresponding to the specified direction vector.

Direction.documentation: The direction vector from which to acquire a horizontal angle in degrees. The vector is unitized before calculation begins. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Horizontal Angle Towards
values.documentation: The horizontal angle in degrees from a player’s current forward direction to the specified position. The result is positive if the position is on the player’s left, otherwise the result is zero or negative.

Player.documentation: The player whose current facing angle begins. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

Position.documentation: The position in the world in where the angle ends.

values.name: Horizontal Facing Angle Of
values.documentation: The directional angle in degrees of a player’s current facing relative to the world. This value increases as the player rotates to the left (wrapping around at +/- 180).

Player.documentation: The player whose facing direction to acquire. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Horizontal Speed Of
values.documentation: The current horizontal speed of a player in meters per second. This measurement excludes all vertical motion.

Player.documentation: The player whose facing direction to acquire. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Index Of Array Value
values.documentation: The index of a value within an array or -1 if no such value can be found.

Array.documentation: The array in which to search for the specified value. Can use most Array based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

Value.documentation: The value for which to search. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to retrive this value.

values.name: Is Alive
values.documentation: Determines whether a player is alive. Returns a Boolean value.

Player.documentation: The player whose life to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrive this value.

values.name: Is Assembling Heroes
values.documentation: Whether the match is currently in its assemble heroes phase.

values.name: Is Between Rounds
values.documentation: Whether the match is between rounds.

values.name: Is Button Held
values.documentation: Whether a player is holding a specific button.

Player.documentation: The player whose button to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

Button.documentation: The button to check. Designed by any action inputs by ability but not directional inputs. (i.e. Primary Fire, Secondary Fire, Ultimate Ability, Jump, Crouch, etc.)

values.name: Is Communicating
values.documentation: Whether a player is using a specific communication type (such as emote, using a voice line, etc.).

Player.documentation: The player whose communication status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

Type.documentation: The type of communication to consider. The duration of emotes is exact, the duration of voice lines is assumed to be 4 seconds, and all other durations are assumed to be 2 seconds. Any of the four emote slots, four voice lines slots, or any standard communication (Need healing, Ultimate Status, etc.) can be designated.

values.name: Is Communicating Any
values.documentation: Whether a player is using any communication type (such as emoting, using a voice line, etc.)

Player.documentation: The player whose communication status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Communicating Any Emote
values.documentation: Whether a player is using a emote.

Player.documentation: The player whose emoting status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Communicating Any Voice Line
values.documentation: Whether a player is using a voice line. (The duration of a voice line is assumed to be 4 seconds.)

Player.documentation: The player whose voice line status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Control Mode Point Locked
values.documentation: Whether the point is locked in control mode.

values.name: Is Crouching
values.documentation: Whether a player is crouching.

Player.documentation: The player whose crouching status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is CTF Mode In Sudden Death
values.documentation: Whether the current game of capture the flag is in sudden death.

values.name: Is Dead
values.documentation: Whether a player is dead.

Player.documentation: The player whose death to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Firing Primary
values.documentation: Whether the specified player’s primary weapon attack is being used.

Player.documentation: The player whose primary weapon attack to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Firing Secondary
values.documentation: Whether the specified player’s secondary weapon attack is being used.

Player.documentation: The player whose secondary weapon attack to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Flag At Base
values.documentation: Whether a specific team’s flag is at its base in capture the flag.

Team.documentation: The player whose flag to check. Can use most team based Value Syntax to retrive this value.

values.name: Is Game In Progress
values.documentation: Whether the main phase of the match is in progress (during which time combat and scoring are allowed).

values.name: Is Hero Being Played
values.documentation: Whether a specific hero is being played (either on a team or in the match).

Hero.documentation: The hero to check for play. Can use most team based Value Syntax to retrive this value. Any applicable Hero based Value Syntax can be used.

Team.documentation: The team or teams on which to check for the hero being played. Can use most team based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is In Air
values.documentation: Whether a player is airborne.

Player.documentation: The player whose airborne status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is In Line Of Sight
values.documentation: Whether two positions have line of sight with each other.

Start Pos.documentation: The start position for the line of sight check. Most positional based Value Syntax can be used here.

End Pos.documentation: The end position for the line of sight check. Most positional based Value Syntax can be used here.

Barriers.documentation: Defines how barriers affect line of sight, when considering whether a barrier belongs to an enemy, the allegiance of the player provided to start pos (if any) is used. Can be set to “Barriers do not block LOS”, Enemy barriers block LOS", and “All barriers block LOS”.

values.name: Is In Setup
values.documentation: Whether the match is currently in its setup phase.

values.name: Is In Spawn Room
values.documentation: Whether a specific player is in the spawn room (and is thus being healed and able to change heroes).

Player.documentation: The player whose spawn room status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is In View Angle
values.documentation: Whether a location is within view of a player.

Player.documentation: The player whose view to use for the check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

Location.documentation: The location to test if it’s within view. Most positional based Value Syntax can be used here.

View Angle.documentation: The view angle to compare against in degrees. Can use most angle based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Match Complete
values.documentation: Whether the match has finished.

values.name: Is Moving
values.documentation: Whether a specific player is moving (as defined by having a non-zero constant speed).

Player.documentation: The player whose moving status status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Objective Complete
values.documentation: Whether the specified objective has been completed Results in false if the game mode is not assault, escort, or assault/escort (hybrid).

Number.documentation: The index of the objective to consider, starting at 0 and counting up. Each control point, payload checkpoint, and payload destination has its own index. Can use most number based Value Syntax to retrieve this value. Value must be in the form of an integer (whole number).

values.name: Is On Ground
values.documentation: Whether a player is on the ground (or other walkable surface).

Player.documentation: The player whose ground status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is On Objective
values.documentation: Whether a specific player is currently occupying a payload or capture point.

Player.documentation: The player whose objective status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is On Wall
values.documentation: Whether a player is on a wall (climbing or riding).

Player.documentation: The player whose wall status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Portrait On Fire
values.documentation: Whether a specific player’s portrait is on fire.

Player.documentation: The player whose portrait to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Standing
values.documentation: Whether a player is standing (defined as both not moving and not in the air).

Player.documentation: The player whose standing status to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Team On Defense
values.documentation: Whether the specified team is currently on defense in a standard match.

Team.documentation: The team whose role to check. Can use most Team Based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Team On Offense
values.documentation: Whether the specified team is currently on offense in a standard match.

Team.documentation: The team whose role to check. Can use most Team Based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is True For All
values.documentation: Whether the specified condition evaluates to true for every value in the specified array.

Array.documentation: The array whose values will be considered. Can use most Array Based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

Condition.documentation: The condition that is evaluated for each element of the specified array, Use the current array element value to reference the element of the array currently being considered. Can use most Comparative based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is True For Any
values.documentation: Whether the specified condition evaluates to true for any value in the specified array.

Array.documentation: The array whose values will be considered. Can use most Array Based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

Condition.documentation: The condition that is evaluated for each element of the specified array, Use the current array element value to reference the element of the array currently being considered. Can use most Comparative based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Using Ability 1
values.documentation: Whether the specified player is using ability 1.

Player.documentation: The player whose ability 1 usage to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Using Ability 2
values.documentation: Whether the specified player is using ability 2.

Player.documentation: The player whose ability 2 usage to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Using Ultimate
values.documentation: Whether the specified player is using an ultimate ability.

Player.documentation: The player whose ultimate ability usage to check. Can use most player based Value Syntax to retrieve this value.

values.name: Is Waiting For Players
values.documentation: Whether the match is waiting for players to join before starting.

values.name: Last Created Entity
values.documentation: A reference to the last effect or icon entity created by the event player (or created at the global level).

values.name: Last Damage Over Time ID
values.documentation: An ID representing the most recent damage over time action that was executed by the event player (or executed at the global level).

values.name: Last Heal Over Time ID
values.documentation: An ID representing the most recent heal over time action that was executed by the event player (or executed at the global level).

values.name: Last Of
values.documentation: The value at the end of the specified array. Results in a 0 if the specified array is empty.

Array.documentation: The array from which the value is created. Can use most Array based Value Syntax to provide this data.

values.name: Last Text ID
values.documentation: A reference to the last piece of text created by the event player (or created at the global level) via the create HUD text or create in-world text action.

values.name: Left
values.documentation: Shorthand for the directional vector(1, 0, 0), which points to the left.

values.name: Local Vector Of
values.documentation: The vector in local coordinates corresponding to the provided vector in world coordinates.

World Vector.documentation: The vector in world coordinates that will be converted to local coordinates. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this data.

Relative Player.documentation: The player to whom the resulting vector will be relative. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this data.

Transformation.documentation: Specifies whether the vector should receive a rotation and a translation (usually applied to positions) or only a rotation (usually applied to directions and velocities). You can choose from Rotation or Rotation and Translation. Rotation is that the resulting vector will be rotated to the new frame of reference. Use this option when the provided vector is in a direction or velocity. Rotation and translation is that the resulting vector will be rotated and translated to the new frame of reference. Use this option when the provided vector is a position.

values.name: Match Round
values.documentation: The current round of the match, counting up from 1. This will return a numerical value

values.name: Match Time
values.documentation: The amount of time in seconds remaining in the current game mode phase. This will return a numerical value.

values.name: Max
values.documentation: The greater of the two numbers. This will return a numerical value of two number values compared.

Value.documentation: The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number. Can use any Number based Value syntax to compare with.
The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number. Can use any Number based Value syntax to compare with.

values.name: Max Health
values.documentation: The max health of a player, including armor and shields.

Player.documentation: The player whose max health to compare. Can use any Player based Value syntax to provide with.

values.name: Min
values.documentation: The lesser of the two numbers. This will return a numerical value of two number values compared.

Value.documentation: The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number. Can use any Number based Value syntax to compare with.
The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number. Can use any Number based Value syntax to compare with.

values.name: Modulo
values.documentation: The remainder of the left-hand operand divided by the right-hand operand. Any number modulo zero will result in zero. This will return a numerical value of two number values compared. For example 7 divided by 2 will result in 1 for the Modulo.

Value.documentation: The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number. Can use any Number based Value syntax.
The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number. Can use any Number based Value syntax.

values.name: Multiply
values.documentation: The product of two numbers or vectors. A vector multiplied by a number will yield a scaled vector.

Value.documentation: The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number or a vector. Can use any Number based or Vector based Value syntax to multiply with.
The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number or a vector. Can use any Number based or Vector based Value syntax to multiply with.

values.name: Nearest Walkable Position
values.documentation: The position closest to the specified position that can be stood on and is accessible from a spawn point.

Position.documentation: The position from which to search for the nearest walkable position. Can use any Vector based Value syntax to divide with.

values.name: Normalize
values.documentation: The unit-length normalization of a vector.

Vector.documentation: The vector to normalize. Can use any Vector based Value syntax to divide with.

values.name: Not
values.documentation: Whether the input is false (or the equivalent to false)

Value.documentation: When this input is false (or equivalent to false), then the not value is true. Otherwise, the not value is false. Can use most Boolean-based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Null
values.documentation: The absence of a player, used when no player is desired for a particular input, equivalent to the real number 0 for the purposes of comparison and debugging.

values.name: Number
values.documentation: A real number constant.

values.name: Number Of Dead Players
values.documentation: The number of dead players on a team or in the match.

Team.documentation: The team or teams on which to count players. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Number Of Deaths
values.documentation: The number of deaths a specific player has earned. This value only accumulates while a game is in progress.

Player.documentation: The player whose death count to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Number Of Eliminations
values.documentation: The number of eliminations a specific player has earned. This value only accumulates while a game is in progress.

Player.documentation: The player whose elimination count to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Number Of Final Blows
values.documentation: The number of final blows a specific player has earned. This value only accumulates while a game is in progress.

Player.documentation: The player whose final blow count to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Number Of Heroes
values.documentation: The number of players playing a specific hero on a team or in the match.

Hero.documentation: The hero to check for play. Can use most Hero based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Team.documentation: The team or teams on which to check for the hero being played. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Number Of Living Players
values.documentation: The number of living players on a team or in the match.

Team.documentation: The team or teams on which to count players. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Number Of Players
values.documentation: The number of players on a team or in the match.

Team.documentation: The team or teams on which to count players. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Number Of Players On Objective
values.documentation: The number of players occupying a payload or a control point (either on a team or in the match).

Team.documentation: The team or teams on which to count players. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Objective Index
values.documentation: The control point, payload checkpoint, or payload destination currently active (either 0, 1, or 2). Valid in Assault, Assault/Escort (Hybrid), Escort, and Control.

values.name: Objective Position
values.documentation: The position in the world of the specified objective (either a control point, a payload checkpoint, or a payload destination) Valid in Assault, Assault/Escort (Hybrid), Escort, and Control.

Number.documentation: The index of the objective to consider, starting at 0 and counting up. Each control point, payload checkpoint, and payload destination as its own index. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value, but must output in a integer of 0, 1, or 2.

values.name: Opposite Team Of
values.documentation: The team opposite the specified team.

Team.documentation: The team whose opposite to acquire. If all, the result will be all. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Or
values.documentation: Whether either of the two inputs are true (or equivalent to true).

Value.documentation: One of the two inputs considered. If either one is true (or equivalent to true), then the OR value is true. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax to provide this value.
One of the two inputs considered. If either one is true (or equivalent to true), then the OR value is true. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Payload Position
values.documentation: The position in the world of the active payload.

values.name: Payload Progress Percentage
values.documentation: The current progress towards the destination for the active payload (expressed as a percentage).

values.name: Player Carrying Flag
values.documentation: The player carrying a particular team’s flag in capture the flag. Results in null if no player is carrying the flag.

Team.documentation: The team whose whose flag to check. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Player Closest To Reticle
values.documentation: The player closest to the reticle of the specified player, optionally restricted by team.

Player.documentation: The player from whose reticle to search for the closest player. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Team.documentation: The team or teams on which to search for the closest player. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Player Variable
values.documentation: The current value of a player variable, which is a variable that belongs to a specific player.

Player.documentation: The player whose variable to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Variable.documentation: Variable specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

values.name: Players In Slot
values.documentation: The player or array of players who occupy a specific slot in the game.

Slot.documentation: The slot number from each to acquire a player or players. In team games, each team has slots 0 through 5. In free-for-all games, slots are numbered 0 through 11. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Team.documentation: The team or teams from which to acquire a player or players. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Players In View Angle
values.documentation: The players who are within a specific view angle of a specific player’s reticle, optionally restricted by team.

Player.documentation: The player whose view to use for the check. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Team.documentation: The team or teams on which to consider players. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

View Angle.documentation: The view angle to compare against in degrees. Can use most Angle based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Players On Hero
values.documentation: The array of players playing a specific hero on a team or in the match.

Hero.documentation: The hero to check for play. Can use most Hero based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Team.documentation: The team or teams on which to check for the hero being played. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Players Within Radius
values.documentation: An array containing all players within a certain distance of a position, optionally restricted by team and line of sight.

Center.documentation: The center position from which to measure distance. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Radius.documentation: The radius in meters inside which players must be in order to be included in the resulting array. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Team.documentation: The team or teams to which a player must belong to be included in the resulting array. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

LOS Check.documentation: Specifies whether and how a player must pass a line-of-sight check to be included in the resulting array. You can choose from Off, Surfaces, Surfaces and Enemy Barriers, and Surfaces and All Barriers. Off will result in the line of sight is never blocked, allowing results through walls. Surfaces will result in line of sight is blocked by ceilings, walls, floors, platforms, and any fixed object that blocks projectiles. Surfaces and Enemy Barriers will result in line of sight is blocked by ceilings, walls, floors, platforms, any fixed object that blocks projectiles, and barriers created by the enemy team. Surfaces and All Barriers will result in line of sight is blocked by ceilings, walls, floors, platforms, any fixed object that blocks projectiles, and all barriers.

values.name: Point Capture Percentage
values.documentation: The current progress towards capture for the active control point (expressed as a percentage).

values.name: Position Of
values.documentation: The current position of a player as a vector.

Player.documentation: The player whose position to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Raise To Power
values.documentation: The left-hand operand raised to the power of the right-hand operand. For example 2 ^ 3 = 8

Value.documentation: The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.
The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Random Integer
values.documentation: A random integer between the specified min and max, inclusive.

Min.documentation: The smallest integer allowed. If a real number is provided to this input, it is rounded to the nearest integer. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Max.documentation: The largest integer allowed. If a real number is provided to this input, it is rounded to the nearest integer. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Random Real
values.documentation: A random real number between the specified min and max.

Min.documentation: The smallest real number allowed. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Max.documentation: The largest real number allowed. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Random Value In Array
values.documentation: A random value from the specified array.

Array.documentation: The array from which to randomly take a value. If a non-array value is provided, the result is simply the provided value. Can use most Array based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Randomized Array
values.documentation: A copy of the specified array with the values in a random order

Array.documentation: The array whose copy will be randomized. Can use most Array based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Ray Cast Hit Normal
values.documentation: The surface normal at the ray cast hit position (or from end pos to start pos if no hit occurs).

Start POS.documentation: The start position for the ray cast. If a player is provided. A position 2 meters above the player’s feet is used. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

End POS.documentation: The end position for the ray cast. If a player is provided. A position 2 meters above the player’s feet is used. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Players To Include.documentation: Which players can be hit by this ray cast. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Players To Exclude.documentation: Which players cannot be hit by this ray cast. This list takes precedence over players to include. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Include Player Owned Objects.documentation: Whether player owned objects (such as barriers or turrets) should be included in the ray cast. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Ray Cast Hit Player
values.documentation: The player hit by the ray cast (or null if no player is hit).

Start POS.documentation: The start position for the ray cast. If a player is provided. A position 2 meters above the player’s feet is used. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

End POS.documentation: The end position for the ray cast. If a player is provided. A position 2 meters above the player’s feet is used. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Players To Include.documentation: Which players can be hit by this ray cast. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Players To Exclude.documentation: Which players cannot be hit by this ray cast. This list takes precedence over players to include. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Include Player Owned Objects.documentation: Whether player owned objects (such as barriers or turrets) should be included in the ray cast. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Ray Cast Hit Position
values.documentation: The position where the ray cast hits a surface, object, or player (or the end POS if no hit occurs).

Start POS.documentation: The start position for the ray cast. If a player is provided. A position 2 meters above the player’s feet is used. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

End POS.documentation: The end position for the ray cast. If a player is provided. A position 2 meters above the player’s feet is used. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Players To Include.documentation: Which players can be hit by this ray cast. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Players To Exclude.documentation: Which players cannot be hit by this ray cast. This list takes precedence over players to include. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Include Player Owned Objects.documentation: Whether player owned objects (such as barriers or turrets) should be included in the ray cast. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Remove From Array
values.documentation: A copy of an array with one or more values removed (if found).

Array.documentation: The array from which to remove values. Can use most Array based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Value.documentation: The value to remove from the array (if found), if this value itself an array, each matching element is removed. Can use most Array based or Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Right
values.documentation: Shorthand for the directional vector (-1, 0, 0), which points to the right.

values.name: Round To Integer
values.documentation: The integer to which the specified value rounds.

Value.documentation: The real number to round. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Rounding Type.documentation: Determines the direction in which the value will be rounded. You can round up, down, or to the nearest integer.

values.name: Score Of
values.documentation: The current score of a player. Results in 0 if the game mode is not free-for-all.

Player.documentation: The player whose score to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Sine From Degrees
values.documentation: Sine of the specified angle in degrees. The sine is the ratio of the length of the side that is opposite  that angle to the length of the longest side of the triangle (the hypotenuse).

Angle.documentation: Angle in degrees. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Sine From Radians
values.documentation: Sine of the specified angle in radians. The sine is the ratio of the length of the side that is opposite  that angle to the length of the longest side of the triangle (the hypotenuse). A radian is a unit of angle, equal to an angle at the center of a circle whose arc is equal in length to the radius.

Angle.documentation: Angle in radians. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Slot Of
values.documentation: The slot number of the specified player. In team games, each team has slots 0 through 5. In free-for-all games, slots are numbers 0 through 11.

Player.documentation: The player whose slot number to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Sorted Array
values.documentation: A copy of the specified array with the values sorted according to the value rank that is evaluated for each element.

Array.documentation: The array whose copy will be sorted. Can use most Array based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Value Rank.documentation: The value that is evaluated for each element of the copied array. The array is sorted by this rank in ascending order. Use the current array element value to reference the element of the array currently being considered. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Speed Of
values.documentation: The current speed of a player in meters per second.

Player.documentation: The player whose speed to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Speed Of In Direction
values.documentation: The current speed of a player in a specific direction in meters per second.

Player.documentation: The player whose speed to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Direction.documentation: The direction of travel in which to measure the player’s speed. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Square Root
values.documentation: The square root of the specified value. For example the square root of 9 is 3.

Value.documentation: The real number value whose square root will be computed. Negative values result in zero. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: String
values.documentation: Text formed from a selection of strings and specified values.

{0}.documentation: The first value in the string.

{1}.documentation: The second value in the string.

{2}.documentation: The third value in the string.

values.name: Subtract
values.documentation: The difference between two numbers or vectors.

Value.documentation: The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number or a vector. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.
The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number or a vector. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Team
values.documentation: A team constant. The all option represents both teams in a team or all players in a free-for-all game.

Team.documentation: Specifies which team the value outputs to. This can be set to All, Team 1, or Team 2.

values.name: Team Of
values.documentation: The team of a player. If the game mode is free-for-all, the team is considered to be all.

Player.documentation: The player whose team to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Team Score
values.documentation: The current score for the specified team. Results in a 0 in free-for-all game modes.

Team.documentation: The team whose score to acquire. Can use most Team based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Throttle Of
values.documentation: The directional input of a player, represented by a vector with a horizontal input on the X component (positive to the left) and vertical input on the Z component (positive upward).

Player.documentation: The player whose directional input to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: True
values.documentation: The Boolean value of true.

values.name: Ultimate Charge Percent
values.documentation: The current ultimate ability charge percentage of a player.

Player.documentation: The player whose ultimate charge percentage to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Up
values.documentation: Shorthand for the directional vector(0, 1, 0). Which points upward.

values.name: Value In Array
values.documentation: The value found at a specific element of an array. Results in a 0 if the element does not exist.

Array.documentation: The array whose element to acquire. Can use most Array based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Index.documentation: The index whose element to acquire. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Vector
values.documentation: A vector composed of three real numbers (X, Y, Z) where X is left, Y is Up, and Z is forward. Vectors are used for position, direction, and velocity.

X.documentation: The X value of the Vector. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Y.documentation: The Y value of the vector. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Z.documentation: The Z value of the Vector. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Vector Towards
values.documentation: The displacement vector from one position to another.

Start Pos.documentation: The start position for the line of sight check. Most positional based Value Syntax can be used here.

End Pos.documentation: The end position for the line of sight check. Most positional based Value Syntax can be used here.

values.name: Velocity Of
values.documentation: The current velocity of a player as a vector. If the player is on a surface, the Y component of this velocity will be 0m even when traveling up or down a slope.

Player.documentation: The player whose velocity to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Vertical Angle From Direction
values.documentation: The vertical angle in degrees corresponding to the specified direction vector.

Direction.documentation: The direction vector from which to acquire a vertical angle in degrees. The vector is unitized before calculations begins. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Vertical Angle Towards
values.documentation: The vertical angle in degrees from a player’s current forward direction to the specified position. The result is positive if the position is below the player. Otherwise, the result is zero or negative.

Position.documentation: The player whose current facing the angle begins. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.
The player whose current facing the angle begins. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Vertical Facing Angle Of
values.documentation: The vertical angle in degrees, of a player’s current facing relative to the world. This value increases as the player looks down.

Player.documentation: The player whose vertical facing angle to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Vertical Speed Of
values.documentation: The current vertical speed of a player in meters per second. This measurement excludes all horizontal motion, including motion while traveling up and down slopes.

Player.documentation: The player whose vertical speed to acquire. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Victim
values.documentation: The player that received damage for the event currently being processed by this rule. May be the same as the attacker or the event player.

values.name: World Vector Of
values.documentation: The vector in the world coordinates corresponding to the provided vector in local coordinates.

Local vector.documentation: The vector in local coordinates that will be converted to world coordinates. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Relative Player.documentation: The player to whom the local vector is relative. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to provide this value.

Local Vector.documentation: The vector in local coordinates that will be converted to world coordinates. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: X Component Of
values.documentation: The X Component of the specified Vector, usually representing a leftward amount.

Value.documentation: The vector from which to acquire the X component. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Y Component Of
values.documentation: The Y Component of the specified Vector, usually representing a upward amount.

Value.documentation: The vector from which to acquire the Y component. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

values.name: Z Component Of
values.documentation: The Z Component of the specified Vector, usually representing a forward amount.

Value.documentation: The vector from which to acquire the Z component. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to provide this value.

actions.name: Abort
actions.documentation: Stops execution of the action list.

actions.name: Abort If
actions.documentation: Stops execution of the action list if the action’s condition evaluates to true, if it does not, the execution continues with the next action.

Condition.documentation: Specifies whether the execution is stopped. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Abort If Condition Is False
actions.documentation: Stops execution of the action list if at least one condition in the condition list is false. If all conditions are true, execution continues with the next action.

actions.name: Abort If Condition Is True
actions.documentation: Stops execution of the action list if all conditions in the condition list is true. If any are false, execution continues with the next action.

actions.name: Allow Button
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of the disallow button action for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose button is being reenabled. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Button.documentation: The logical button that is being reenabled.

actions.name: Big Message
actions.documentation: Displays a large message above the reticle that is visible to specific players.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will see the message. Can use most Value Syntax to select multiple players to specify.

Header.documentation: The message to be displayed. Can use most String based Value Syntax to specify.

actions.name: Chase Global Variable At Rate
actions.documentation: Gradually modifies the value of a global variable at a specific rate. (A global variable is a variable that belongs to the game itself.)

Variable.documentation: The variable the action will manipulate. Can use most Variable based Value Syntax.

Destination.documentation: The value that the global variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector, through the variable’s existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins. Can use most Number or Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Rate.documentation: The amount of change that will happen to the variable’s value each second. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can specify a Destination and Rate or nothing.

actions.name: Chase Global Variable Over Time
actions.documentation: Gradually modifies the value of a global variable over time. (A global variable is a variable that belongs to the game itself.)

Variable.documentation: The variable the action will manipulate. Can use most Variable based Value Syntax.

Destination.documentation: The value that the global variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector, through the variable’s existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins. Can use most Number or Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Duration.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, over which the variable’s value will approach the destination. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can specify a Destination and Duration or nothing.

actions.name: Chase Player Variable At Rate
actions.documentation: Gradually modifies the value of a player variable at a specific rate. (A player variable is a variable that belongs to a specific player.)

Player.documentation: The player whose variable will gradually change. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will change independently.

Variable.documentation: The variable the action will manipulate. Can use most Variable based Value Syntax.

Destination.documentation: The value that the player variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector, through the variable’s existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins. Can use most Number or Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Rate.documentation: The amount of change that will happen to the variable’s value each second. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can specify a Destination and Rate or nothing.

actions.name: Chase Player Variable Over Time
actions.documentation: Gradually modifies the value of a player variable over time. (A player variable is a variable that belongs to a specific player.)

Player.documentation: The player whose variable will gradually change. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will change independently.

Variable.documentation: The variable the action will manipulate. Can use most Variable based Value Syntax.

Destination.documentation: The value that the player variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector, through the variable’s existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins. Can use most Number or Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Duration.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, over which the variable’s value will approach the destination. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can specify a Destination and Duration or nothing.

actions.name: Clear Status
actions.documentation: Clears a status that was applied from a set status action from one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players from whom the status will be removed. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Status.documentation: The Status to be removed from the player or players. Values include Hacked, Burning, Knocked Down, Asleep, Frozen, Unkillable, Invincible, Phased Out, Rooted, or Stunned.

actions.name: Communicate
actions.documentation: Causes one or more players to use an emote, voice line, or other equipped communication.

Player.documentation: The player or players to perform the communication. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Type.documentation: The type of communication. Can use any equipped emote, equipped voice line, or any other communication effect.

actions.name: Create Beam Effect
actions.documentation: Creates an in-world beam effect entity. This effect entity will persist until destroyed, to obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will be able to see the effect. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Beam Type.documentation:
The type of the effect to be created.

Good Beam
Bad Beam
Grapple Beam

Start Position.documentation: The effect’s start position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player, otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

End Position.documentation: The effect’s end position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player, otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

Color.documentation: The color of the beam effect to be created. IF a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer. Does not apply to sound effects.

Reevaluation.documentation:
Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continuously reevaluated, the effect will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

Visible to, position, and radius
Position and radius
Visible to
None

actions.name: Create Dummy Bot
actions.documentation: Adds a new bot to the specified slot on the specified team so long as the slot is available. This bot will only move, fire, or use abilities if executing Workshop actions.

Hero.documentation: The hero that the bot will be. If more than one hero is provided, one will be chosen at random.

Team.documentation: The team on which to create the bot. The “ALL” option only works in Free-For-All game modes, while the “TEAM” options only work in team-based game modes.

Slot.documentation: The player slot which will receive the bot (-1 for first available slot). Up to 6 bots may be added to each team, or 12 bots to the Free-For-All team, regardless of lobby settings.

Position.documentation: The initial position where the bot will appear.

Facing.documentation: The initial direction where the bot will face.

actions.name: Create Effect
actions.documentation: Creates an in-world effect entity. This effect entity will persist until destroyed, to obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will be able to see the effect. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Type.documentation:
The type of the effect to be created.

Sphere
Light Shaft
Orb
Ring
Cloud
Sparkles
Good Aura
Bad Aura
Energy Sound
Pick-Up Sound
Good Aura Sound
Bad Aura Sound
Sparkles Sound
Smoke Sound
Decal Sound
Beacon Sound

Color.documentation: The color of the effect to be created. IF a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer. Does not apply to sound effects.

Position.documentation: The effect’s position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player, otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

Radius.documentation: The effect’s radius in meters. Sound effects have their volume affected instead.

Reevaluation.documentation:
Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continuously reevaluated, the effect will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

Visible to, position, and scale
Position and scale
Visible to
None

actions.name: Create HUD Text
actions.documentation: Creates HUD text visible to specific players at specific location on the screen. This text will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this text, use the last text ID value. This action will fail if too many text elements have been created.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will see the HUD text. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Header.documentation: The header text to be displayed (can be blank). Can use most String based Value Syntax to populate.

Subheader.documentation: The subheader text to be displayed (can be blank). Can use most String based Value Syntax to populate.

Text.documentation: The body text to be displayed (can be blank). Can use most String based Value Syntax to populate.

Location.documentation: The location on the screen where text will appear. You can choose left, top, or right.

Sort Order.documentation: The Sort Order of the text relative to other text in the same location. Text with a higher sort order will come after text with a lower sort order. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Header Color.documentation: The color of the Header text to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue.

Subheader Color.documentation: The color of the Subheader text to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue.

Text Color.documentation: The color of the body text to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue.

Reevaluation.documentation:
Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continuously reevaluated, the text will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

Visible to and String
String
None

actions.name: Create Icon
actions.documentation: Creates an in-world entity. This icon entity will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will be able to see the icon. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Position.documentation: The icon’s position. If this value is a player, then the icon will appear above the player’s head, otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

Icon.documentation:
The icon to be created.

Arrow: Down
Arrow: Left
Arrow: Right
Arrow: Up
Asterisk
Bolt
Checkmark
Circle
Club
Diamond
Dizzy
Exclamation Mark
Eye
Fire
Flag
Halo
Happy
Heart
Moon
No
Plus
Poison
Poison 2
Question Mark
Radioactive
Recycle
Ring Thick
Ring Thin
Sad
Skull
Spade
Spiral
Stop
Trashcan
Warning
X

Reevaluation.documentation:
Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continously reevaluated, the icon will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

Visible to and position
Position
Visible to
None

Icon Color.documentation: The color of the icon to be created. IF a particular team is chosen, the icon will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer.

Show When Offscreen.documentation: Should this icon still appear even when it is behind you? Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax to specify.

actions.name: Create In-World Text
actions.documentation: Creates in-world text visible to specific players at specific position in the world. This text will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this text, use the last text ID value. This action will fail if too many text elements have been created.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will see the HUD text. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Header.documentation: The header text to be displayed (can be blank). Can use most String based Value Syntax to populate.

Position.documentation: The text’s position. If this value is a player, then the text will appear above the player’s head. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

Scale.documentation: The text’s scale. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Clipping.documentation:
Specifies whether the text can be seen through walls or is instead clipped.

Clip Against Surfaces - The text may be partially or completely obscured by walls, floors, ceilings, players, or other solid objects.
Do not clip - The text will always be fully visible. Even if it is behind a wall or solid object.

Reevaluation.documentation:
Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continuously reevaluated, the text will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

Visible to, Position, and String
Visible to and String
None

actions.name: Damage
actions.documentation: Applies instantaneous damage to one or more players, possibly killing the players.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will receive damage. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Damager.documentation: The player who will receive credit for the damage. A damager of null indicates no player will receive credit. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Amount.documentation: The amount of damage to apply. This amount may be modified by buffs, debuffs, or armor. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Declare Match Draw
actions.documentation: Instantly ends the match in a draw. This action has no effect in free-for-all modes.

actions.name: Declare Player Victory
actions.documentation: Instantly ends the match with the specific player as the winner. This action only has an effect in free-for-all modes.

Player.documentation: The winning player. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Declare Round Victory
actions.documentation: Declare a team as the current round winner. This only works in the control and elimination game modes.

actions.name: Declare team Victory
actions.documentation: Instantly ends the match with the specified team as the winner. This action has no effect in free-for-all modes.

Team.documentation: The winning team. Can use most Team based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Destroy All Dummy Bots
actions.documentation: Removes all dummy bots from the match.

actions.name: Destroy All Effects
actions.documentation: Destroys all effect entities created by create effect.

actions.name: Destroy All Icons
actions.documentation: Destroys all icon entities created by create icon.

actions.name: Destroy All In-World Text
actions.documentation: Destroys all in-world text created by the create in-world effect.

actions.name: Destroy Dummy Bot
actions.documentation: Removes the specified dummy bot from the match.

Team.documentation: The team to remove the dummy bot from. The “ALL” option only works in Free-For-All game modes, while the “TEAM” options only work in team-based game modes.

Slot.documentation: The slot to remove the dummy bot from.

actions.name: Destroy Effect
actions.documentation: Destroys an effect entity that was created by create effect.

actions.name: Destroy HUD Text
actions.documentation: Destroys hud text that was created by create hud text.

Text ID.documentation: Specifies which hud text to destroy. This ID may be last text ID or a variable into which last text ID was earlier stored.

actions.name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Announcer
actions.documentation: Disables game mode announcements from the announcer until reenabled or the match ends.

actions.name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Completion
actions.documentation: Disables completion of the match from the game mode itself, only allowing the match to be completed by scripting commands.

actions.name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Music
actions.documentation: Disables all game-mode music until reenabled or the match ends.

actions.name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Respawning
actions.documentation: Disables automatic respawning for one or more players, only allowing respawning by scripting commands.

actions.name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Scoring
actions.documentation: Disables changes to player and team scores from the game mode itself, only allowing scores to be changed by scripting commands.

actions.name: Disable Death Spectate All Players
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of the enable death spectate all players action for one or more players.

actions.name: Disable Death Spectate Target HUD
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of the enable death spectate target hud action for one or more players.

actions.name: Disallow Button
actions.documentation: Disables a logical button for one or more players such that pressing it has no effect.

Player.documentation: The player executing this rule, as specified by the event. May be the same as the attacker or victim. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Enable Built-In Game Mode Announcer
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of the disable built-in game mode announcer action.

actions.name: Enable Built-In Game Mode Completion
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of the disable built-in game mode completion action.

actions.name: Enable Built-In Game Mode Music
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of the disable built-in game mode music action.

actions.name: Enable Built-In Game Mode Respawning
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of the disable built-in game mode respawning for one or more players.

actions.name: Enable Built-In Game Mode Scoring
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of the disable built-in game mode scoring action.

actions.name: Enable Death Spectate All Players
actions.documentation: Allows one or more players to spectate all players when dead, as opposed to only allies.

actions.name: Enable Death Spectate Target HUD
actions.documentation: Allows one or more players to see their target’s HUD when dead instead of their own while death spectating.

actions.name: Go To Assemble Heroes
actions.documentation: Go to the assemble heroes phase of the game mode. Only works if a game is in progress.

actions.name: Heal
actions.documentation: Provides an instantaneous heal to one or more players. This heal will not resurrect dead players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose health will be restored. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Healer.documentation: The player who will receive credit for the healing. A healer of null indicates no player will receive credit. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Amount.documentation: The amount of healing to apply. This amount may be modified by buffs or debuffs, healing is capped by each player’s max health. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Kill
actions.documentation: Instantly kills one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will be killed. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Killer.documentation: The player who will receive credit for the kill. A killer of null indicates no player will receive credit. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Loop
actions.documentation: Restarts the action list from the beginning. To prevent an infinite loop, a wait action must execute between the start of the action list and this action.

actions.name: Loop If
actions.documentation: Restarts the action list from the beginning if this action’s condition evaluates to true. If it does not, execution continues with the next action. To prevent an infinite loop, a wait action must execute between the start of the action list and this action.

Condition.documentation: Specifies whether the loop will occur. Can use most Conditional based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Modify Global Variable
actions.documentation: Modifies the value of a global variable, which is a variable that belongs to the game itself.

Variable.documentation: Variable specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Operation.documentation: The way in which the variable’s value will be changed. Options include standard arithmetic operations as well as array operations for appending and removing values.

Value.documentation: The value used for the modification. For arithmetic operations, this is the second of two operands, with the other being the variable’s existing value. For array operations, this is the value to append or remove. Various Value Syntax can be used.

actions.name: Modify Global Variable At Index
actions.documentation: Modifies the value of a global variable at an index, which is a variable that belongs to the game itself.

Variable.documentation: Variable specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Index.documentation: The index of the array to modify. If the index is beyond the end of the array, the array is extended with new elements given a value of 0.

Operation.documentation: The way in which the variable’s value will be changed. Options include standard arithmetic operations as well as array operations for appending and removing values.

Value.documentation: The value used for the modification. For arithmetic operations, this is the second of two operands, with the other being the variable’s existing value. For array operations, this is the value to append or remove. Various Value Syntax can be used.

actions.name: Modify Player Score
actions.documentation: Modifies the score (kill count) of one or more players. This action only has an effect in free-for-all modes.

Player.documentation: The player whose score will change. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Score.documentation: The amount the score will increase or decrease. If positive, the score will increase. If negative, the score will decrease. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Modify Player Variable
actions.documentation: Modifies the value of a player variable, which is a variable that belongs to a specific player.
