Player.documentation: The player whose variable will be modified. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Variable.documentation: Variable specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Operation.documentation: The way in which the variable’s value will be changed. Options include standard arithmetic operations as well as array operations for appending and removing values.

Value.documentation: The value used for the modification. For arithmetic operations, this is the second of two operands, with the other being the variable’s existing value. For array operations, this is the value to append or remove. Various Value Syntax can be used.

actions.name: Modify Player Variable At Index
actions.documentation: Modifies the value of a player variable at an index, which is a variable that belongs to a specific player.

Player.documentation: The player whose variable will be modified. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Variable.documentation: Variable specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Index.documentation: The index of the array to modify. If the index is beyond the end of the array, the array is extended with new elements given a value of 0.

Operation.documentation: The way in which the variable’s value will be changed. Options include standard arithmetic operations as well as array operations for appending and removing values.

Value.documentation: The value used for the modification. For arithmetic operations, this is the second of two operands, with the other being the variable’s existing value. For array operations, this is the value to append or remove. Various Value Syntax can be used.

actions.name: Modify Team Score
actions.documentation: Modifies the score of one or both teams. This action has not effect in free-for-all modes or modes without a team score.

Team.documentation: The team whose score will be changed. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Score.documentation: The amount the score will increase or decrease. If positive, the score will increase. If negative, the score will decrease. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Pause Match Time
actions.documentation: Pauses the match time, players, objective logic, and game mode advancement criteria are unaffected by the pause.

actions.name: Play Effect
actions.documentation: Plays an effect at a position in the world. The lifetime of this effect is short, so it does not need to be updated or destroyed.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will be able to see the effect. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Type.documentation:
The type of the effect to be created.

Good Explosion
Bad Explosion
Ring Explosion
Good Pickup Effect
Bad Pickup Effect
Debuff Impact Sound
Buff Impact Sound
Ring Explosion Sound
Buff Explosion Sound
Explosion Sound

Color.documentation: The color of the effect to be created. IF a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer.

Position.documentation: The effect’s position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player, otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

Radius.documentation: The effect’s radius in meters. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Preload Hero
actions.documentation: Preemptively loads the specified hero or heroes into memory using the skins of the specified player or players, available memory permitting. Useful whenever rapid hero changing is possible and the next hero is known.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will begin preloading a hero or heroes. Only one preload hero action will be active at a time for a given player. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Hero.documentation: The hero or heroes to begin preloading for the specified player or players. When multiple heroes are specified in an array, the Heroes towards the beginning of the array are prioritized. Can use most Hero based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Press Button
actions.documentation: Forces one or more players to press a button virtually for a single frame.

Player.documentation: The player or players for whom virtual button input will be forced. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Reset Player Hero Availability
actions.documentation: Restores the list of heroes available to one or more players to the list specified by the game settings. If a player’s current hero becomes unavailable, the player is forced to choose a different hero and respawn at an appropriate spawn location.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose hero list is being reset. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Respawn
actions.documentation: Respawns one or more players at an appropriate spawn location with full health, even if they were already alive.

Player.documentation: The player or players to respawn. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Resurrect
actions.documentation: Instantly resurrects one or more players at the location they died with no transition.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will be resurrected. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Set Ability 1 Enabled
actions.documentation: Enables or disables ability 1 for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose access to ability 1 is affected. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use ability 1. Expects a Boolean Value such as True, False, or Compare. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Set Ability 2 Enabled
actions.documentation: Enables or disables ability 2 for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose access to ability 2 is affected. Expects a Boolean Value such as True, False, or Compare. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use ability 2. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Set Aim Speed
actions.documentation: Sets the aim speed of one or more players to a percentage of their normal aim speed.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose aim will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Turn Speed Percent.documentation: The percentage of normal aim speed to which the player or players will set their aim speed. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Set Damage Dealt
actions.documentation: Sets the damage dealt to one or more players of a percentage of their raw damage dealt. NOTE: Negative values do not heal enemies. Damage values of 0 or lower will not trigger script events.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose damage dealt will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Damage Dealt Percent.documentation: The percentage of raw damage dealt to which the player or players will set their damage dealt. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Set Damage Received
actions.documentation: Sets the damage received of one or more players to a percentage of their raw damage received. NOTE: Negative values do not heal enemies. Damage values of 0 or lower will not trigger script events.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose damage received will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Set Facing
actions.documentation: Sets the facing of one or more players to the specified direction.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose facing will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Direction.documentation:
The unit direction in which the player or players will face. This value is normalized internally. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax.
*Relative - Specifies direction is relative to world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

actions.name: Set Global Variable
actions.documentation: Stores a value into a global variable, which a variable that belongs to the game itself.

Variable.documentation: Specifies which Global Variable to store the value into. Specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Value.documentation: The value that will be stored. Nearly any Value syntax can be used, however it is most common with Number based syntax.

actions.name: Set Gravity
actions.documentation: Sets the movement gravity for one or more players to a percentage of regular movement gravity.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose movement gravity will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax with this value.

Gravity Percent.documentation: The percentage of regular movement gravity to which the player or players will set their personal movement gravity. Can use most Number based Value Sytax with this value. 100% is the normal gravity level of the game. Less than that will decrease gravity (allowing higher jumps), higher amounts will result in higher gravity (causing shorter jumps).

actions.name: Set Healing Dealt
actions.documentation: Sets the healing dealt to one or more players of a percentage of their raw damage dealt. NOTE: Negative values do not damage enemies. Healing values of 0 or lower will not trigger script events.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose healing dealt will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Healing Dealt Percent.documentation: The percentage of raw healing dealt to which the player or players will set their healing dealt. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Set Healing Received
actions.documentation: Sets the healing received of one or more players to a percentage of their raw healing received. NOTE: Negative values do not damage enemies. Healing values of 0 or lower will not trigger script events.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose healing received will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Healing Received Percent.documentation: The percentage of raw healing received to which the player or players will set their healing received. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Set Invisible
actions.documentation: Causes one or more players to become invisible to either all other players or just enemies.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will become invisible. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Invisible To.documentation: Specifies for whom the player or players will be invisible. Can be set to All, Enemies, or None.

actions.name: Set Match Time
actions.documentation: Sets the current match time (which is visible at the top of the screen). This can be used to shorten or extend the duration of a match or to change the duration of assemble heroes or setup.

actions.name: Set Max Health
actions.documentation: Sets the max health of one or more players as a percentage of their raw max health. This action will ensure that a player’s current health will not exceed the new max health.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose max health will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Health Percent.documentation: The percentage of raw max health to which the player or players will set their max health. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Set Move Speed
actions.documentation: Sets the move speed of one or more players to a percentage of their raw move speed.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose move speed will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Set Objective Description
actions.documentation: Sets the text at the top center of the screen that normally describes the objective to a message visible to specific players.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will see the message. Can use most Number based Player Syntax for this value.

Header.documentation: The message to be displayed. Can use most String based Value Syntax for this value.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continously reevaluated. The message will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. Can choose “Visible to and String” or “String”

actions.name: Set Player Allowed Heroes
actions.documentation: Sets the list of heroes available to one or more players. If a player’s current hero becomes unavailable, the player is forced to choose a different hero and respawn at an appropriate spawn location.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose hero list is being set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Hero.documentation: The hero or heroes that will be available. If no heroes are provided, the action has no effect. Can use most Hero based Value Syntax for this value including compatible Arrays.

actions.name: Set Player Score
actions.documentation: Sets the score (kill count) of one or more players. This action only has an effect in free-for-all modes.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose score will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Score.documentation: The score that will be set. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Set Player Variable
actions.documentation: Stores a value into a player variable, which is a variable that belongs to a specific player.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose variable will be set. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Variable.documentation: Specifies which Player Variable to store the value into. Specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Value.documentation: The value that will be stored. Nearly any Value syntax can be used, however it is most common with Number based syntax.

actions.name: Set Player Variable At Index
actions.documentation: Finds or creates an array on a player variable, which is a variable that belongs to a specific player, then stores a value in the array at the specified index.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose variable will be set. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Variable.documentation: Specifies which player variable’s value is the array to modify, if the variable’s value is not an array, then its value becomes an empty array. Specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Index.documentation: The index of the array to modify. If the index is beyond the end of the array, the array is extended with the new elements given a value of zero. Can use most Number based Value Syntax with this value.

Value.documentation: The value that will be stored into the array. Nearly any Value syntax can be used, however it is most common with Number based syntax.

actions.name: Set Primary Fire Enabled
actions.documentation: Enables or disables primary fire for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose access to primary fire is affected. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use primary fire. Expects a Boolean Value such as True, False, or Compare. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Set Projectile Gravity
actions.documentation: Sets the projectile gravity for one or more players to a percentage of regular projectile gravity.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose projectile gravity will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Projectile Gravity Percent.documentation: The percentage of the regular projectile gravity to which the player or players will set their personal projectile gravity. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Set Projectile Speed
actions.documentation: Sets the projectile speed for one or more players to a percentage of regular projectile speed.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose projectile speed will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Projectile Speed Percent.documentation: The percentage of the regular projectile speed to which the player or players will set their personal projectile speed. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Set Respawn Max Time
actions.documentation: Sets the duration between death and respawn for one or more players that are already dead when this action is executed, the change takes effect on their next death.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose respawn max time will is being defined. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Time.documentation: The duration between death and respawn in seconds. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Set Secondary Fire Enabled
actions.documentation: Enables or disables secondary fire for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose access to secondary fire is affected. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use secondary fire. Expects a Boolean Value such as True, False, or Compare. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Set Slow Motion
actions.documentation: Sets the simulation rate for the entire game, including all players, projectiles, effects, and game mode logic.

Speed Percent.documentation: The simulation rate as a percentage of normal speed. Only rates up to 100% are allowed. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Set Status
actions.documentation: Applies a status to one or more players. This status will remain in effect for the specified duration or until it is cleared by the clear status action.

Player.documentation: The player or players to whom the status will be applied. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Assister.documentation: Specifies a player to be awarded assist credit should the affected player or players be killed while the status is in effect. An assister of null indicates no player will receive credit. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Status.documentation: The Status to be applied from the player or players. These behave similarly to statuses applied from hero abilities. Values include Hacked, Burning, Knocked Down, Asleep, Frozen, Unkillable, Invincible, Phased Out, Rooted, or Stunned.

Duration.documentation: The duration of the status effect in seconds. To have a status that lasts until a clear status action is executed, proivide an arbitrarily long duration such as 9999. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Set Team Score
actions.documentation: Sets the score for one or both teams. This action has no effect in free-for-all modes or modes without a team score.

Team.documentation: The team or teams whose score will be set. Can use most Team based Value Syntax for this value.

Score.documentation: The score that will be set. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

actions.name: Set Ultimate Ability Enabled
actions.documentation: Enables or disables the ultimate ability of one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose access to their ultimate ability is affected. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use their ultimate ability. Expects a Boolean Value such as True, False, or Compare. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Set Ultimate Charge
actions.documentation: Sets the ultimate charge or one or more players as a percentage of maximum charge.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose ultimate charge will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Charge Percent.documentation: The percentage of maximum charge. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Skip
actions.documentation: Skips execution of a certain number of actions in the action list.

Number Of Actions.documentation: The number of action to skip, not including this action. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Skip If
actions.documentation: Skips execution of a certain number of actions in the action list if this action’s condition evaluates to true. If it does not, execution continues with the next action.

Condition.documentation: Specifies whether the loop will occur. Can use most Conditional based Value Syntax for this value.

Number Of Actions.documentation: The number of action to skip, not including this action. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Small Message
actions.documentation: Displays a small message beneath the reticle that is visible to specific players.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will see the message. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Header.documentation: The message to be displayed. Can use most String based Value Syntax to specify.

actions.name: Start Accelerating
actions.documentation: Starts accelerating one or more players in a specified location.

Player.documentation: The player or players that will begin accelerating. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Direction.documentation: The unit direction in which the acceleration will be applied. This value is normalized internally. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Rate.documentation: The rate of acceleration in meters per second squared. This value may need to be quite high in order to overcome gravity and/or surface friction. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Max Speed.documentation: The speed at which acceleration will stop for the player or players. It may not be possible to reach this speed due to gravity and/or surface friction. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Relative.documentation: Specifies whether direction is relavtive to the world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actions inputs will be continously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can choose from “Direction, Rate, and Max Speed” or “None”.

actions.name: Start Camera
actions.documentation: Places your camera at a location, facing a direction.

Player.documentation: The player executing this rule. As specified by the event, may be the same as the attacker or the victim. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Eye Position.documentation: The position of the camrea, reevaluates continously. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Look At Position.documentation: Where the camera looks at, reevaluates continously. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Blend Speed.documentation: How fast to blend the camera movement as positions change. 0 means do not blend at all and just change positions instantly. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Start Damage Modification
actions.documentation: Starts modifying how much damage one or more receivers will receive from one or more damagers. A reference to this damage modification can be obtained from the last damage modification ID value. This action will fail if too many damage modifications have been started.

Receivers.documentation: The player or players whose incoming damage will be modified. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Damagers.documentation: The player or players whose outgoing damage will be modified (when attacking the receivers). Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Damage Percent.documentation: The percentage of damage that will apply to receivers when attacked by damagers. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. Can choose from “Receivers, Damagers, and Damage Percent”, “Receivers and Damagers”, or “None”.

actions.name: Start Damage Over Time
actions.documentation: Starts an instance of damage over time, this DOT will persist for the specified duration or until stopped by script. To obtain a reference to this DOT, use the last damage over time to value.

Receivers.documentation: One or more players who will receive the damage over time. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Duration.documentation: The duration of the damage over time in seconds. To have a DOT that lasts until stopped by script, provide an arbitrarily long duration such as 9999. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Damage Per Second.documentation: The damage per second for the damage over time. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

actions.name: Start Facing
actions.documentation: Starts turning one or more players to face the specified direction.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will start turning. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Direction.documentation: The unit direction in which the player or players will eventually face. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax.

Turn Rate.documentation: The turn rate in degrees per second. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Relative.documentation: Specifies whether direction is relative to the world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actions inputs will be continously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can choose from “Direction and Turn Rate” or “None”.

actions.name: Start Forcing Player To Be Hero
actions.documentation: Starts forcing one or more players to be a specified hero and, if necessary, respawns them immediately in their current locaiton. This will be the only hero available to the player or players until, the stop forcing player to be hero action is executed.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will be forced to be a specified hero. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Hero.documentation: The hero that the player or players will be forced to be. Can use most Hero based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Start Forcing Spawn Room
actions.documentation: Forces a team to spawn in a particular spawn room, regardless of the sapwn room normally used by the game mode. This action only has an effect in Assault, Hybrid, and Payload Maps.

Team.documentation: The team whose spawn room will be forced. Can use most Team based Value Syntax.

Room.documentation: The number of the spawn room to be forced. 0 is the first spawn room, 1 is the second, and 2 is the third. If this specified spawn room does not exist. Players will use the normal spawn room. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Start Forcing Throttle
actions.documentation: Defines minimum and maximum movement input values for one or more players. Possibly forcing or preventing movement.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose movement whill be forced or limited. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Min Forward.documentation: Sets the minimum run forward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Max Forward.documentation: Sets the maximum run forward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Min Backward.documentation: Sets the minimum run backward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Max Backward.documentation: Sets the maximum run backward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Min Sideways.documentation: Sets the minimum run sideways amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Start Heal Over Time
actions.documentation: Starts an instance of damage over time, this HOT will persist for the specified duration or until stopped by script. To obtain a reference to this HOT, use the last damage over time to value.

Player.documentation: One or more players who will receive the heal over time. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Healer.documentation: The player who will receive credit for the heal. A damager of null indicates no player will receive credit. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Duration.documentation: The duration of the heal over time in seconds. To have a HOT that lasts until stopped by script, provide an arbitrarily long duration such as 9999. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

actions.name: Start Holding Button
actions.documentation: Forces one or more players to hold a button virtually until stopped by the stop holding button action.

Player.documentation: The player or players who are holding a button virtually. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Button.documentation: The logical button that is being held virtually.

actions.name: Start Throttle In Direction
actions.documentation: Sets or adds to the throttle (directional input control) of a player or players such that they begin moving in a particular direction. Any previous throttle in direction is cancelled.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose throttle will be set or added to.

Direction.documentation: The unit direction in which the throttle will be set or added to. This value is normalized internally.

Magnitude.documentation: The amount of throttle (or change to throttle). A value of 1 denotes full throttle.

Relative.documentation: Specifies whether direction is relative to world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

Behavior.documentation: Specifies whether preexisting throttle is replaced or added to.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this action’s inputs will be continously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

actions.name: Start Transforming Throttle
actions.documentation: Starts transforming (scaling and rotating) the throttle (directional input control) of a player or players. Cancels any existing START TRANSFORMING THROTTLE behavior.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose throttle will be transformed.

X Axis Scalar.documentation: The player or players will have their throttle X Axis (Left to Right) multiplied by this value before the throttle is rotated to its new relative direction. This value is evaluated continously (meaning it updates every frame).

Y Axis Scalar.documentation: The player or players will have their throttle Y Axis (Front to Back) multiplied by this value before the throttle is rotated to its new relative direction. This value is evaluated continously (meaning it updates every frame).

Relative Direction.documentation: After the axis scalars are applied, the player or players will have their throttle transformed so that it is relative to this unit direction vector. For Example, to make the throttle camera relative, provide the direction that the camera is facing. This value is evaluated continously (meaning it updates every frame) and normalized internally.

actions.name: Stop Accelerating
actions.documentation: Stops the acceleration started by the start accelerating action for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will stop accelerating. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop All Damage Modifications
actions.documentation: Stops the all damage modifications that were started using the start damage modification action.

actions.name: Stop All Damage Over Time
actions.documentation: Stops all damage over time started by the start damage over time or one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose scripted damage over time will stop. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop All Heal Over Time
actions.documentation: Stops all heal over time started by the start heal over time or one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose scripted heal over time will stop. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop Camera
actions.documentation: Stops all forced camera positions started by the start camera or one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose forced camera positions will stop. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop Chasing Global Variable
actions.documentation: Stops an in-progress chase of a global variable, leaving it at its current value.

Variable.documentation: Specifies which global variable to stop modifying. Specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

actions.name: Stop Chasing Player Variable
actions.documentation: Stops an in-progress chase of a player variable, leaving it at its current value.

Player.documentation: The player whose variable will stop changing. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will stop changing. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Variable.documentation: Specifies which player variable to stop modifying. Specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

actions.name: Stop Damage Modification
actions.documentation: Stops a damage modification that was started by the start damage modification action

Damage modification ID.documentation: Specifies which damage modification instance to stop, this ID may be the last damage modification ID or a variable into which last damage modification ID was earlier stored. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop Damage Over Time
actions.documentation: Stops an instance of damage over time that was started by the start damage over time action

Damage Over Time ID.documentation: Specifies which damage over time instance to stop, this ID may be the last damage over time ID or a variable into which last damage over time ID was earlier stored. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop Facing
actions.documentation: Stops the turning started by the start facing action for or one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will stop turning. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop Forcing Player To Be Hero
actions.documentation: Stops forcing one or more players to be a specified hero. This will not respawn the player or players, but it will restore their availablity the next time they go to select a hero.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will no longer be forced to be a specific hero. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop Forcing Spawn Room
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of start forcing spawn room action for the specified team.

Team.documentation: The team that will resume using their normal spawn room. Can use most Team based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop Forcing Throttle
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of start forcing throttle action for one or more players

Player.documentation: The player or players whose movement inout will be restored. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop Heal Over Time
actions.documentation: Stops an instance of heal over time that was started by the start heal over time action

actions.name: Stop Holding Button
actions.documentation: Undoes the effect of the start holding button action for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players who are no longer holding a button virtually. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Stop Throttle In Direction
actions.documentation: Cancels the behavior caused by START THROTTLE IN DIRECTION.

actions.name: Stop Transforming Throttle
actions.documentation: Stops the throttle transform started by START TRANSFORMING THROTTLE for one or more players.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.documentation: Teleports one or more players to the specified location.

Player.documentation: The player or players to teleport. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Position.documentation: The position to which the player or players will teleport. If a player is providedm the position of the player is used. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax.

actions.name: Unpause Match Time
actions.documentation: Unpauses the match time.

actions.name: Wait
actions.documentation: Pauses the execution of the action list, unless the wait is interrupted. The remainder of the actions will execute after the pause.

Time.documentation: The duration of the pause. A minimum value of 0.250 seconds is required. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Wait Behavior.documentation: Specifies if and how the wait can be interrupted. If the condition list is ignored, the wait will not be interrupted, otherwise, the condition list will determine if and when the action list will abort or restart.

actions.name: Remove All Health Pools From Player

ObjectiveRev.name: Visible To Sort Order and String
